name: Match SPARQL variables
description: A handy regular expression to capture any variable in a valid SPARQL query.
content: Select ?Sponsor ?Task ?Location ?StartTime ?EndTime ?Hours ?Log ?TC WHERE { ?TC rdf:type sa:TimeCharge . ?Loc gist:name ?Location . ?TC gist:occurredAt ?Loc .?TC gist:hasMagnitude ?mag . ?mag gist:decimalValue ?Hours .?mag gist:hasUoM ?u.?u gist:name ?unit .?TC sa:consumedToward ?T1 . ?T1 gist:name ?Task . ?T1 sa:hasSponsor ?Spon. ?Spon gist:name ?Sponsor. ?TC sa:consumptionOf '@@person' .?TC gist:actualStart ?ST . ?TC gist:actualEnd ?ET .?ET gist:universalDateTime ?EndTime . ?ST gist:universalDateTime ?StartTime .?TC gist:describedIn ?dia . ?dia gist:text ?Log } ORDER BY DESC( ?StartTime )
author: Scott Ogle
